article_node.title: Social Security stronger under Trump, critics pushing ‘false’ narrative, commissioner says
article_node.summary: Commissioner Frank Bisignano defended the Trump administration's handling of Social Security, claiming that criticisms from Democrats are politically motivated and misleading. He highlighted improvements in customer service, including reduced wait times and increased online transactions, arguing that the agency is more efficient now than in the past. Bisignano also dismissed concerns about staffing cuts, asserting that technological advancements have enhanced service delivery, while President Trump plans to honor the 90th anniversary of the Social Security Act by promoting the administration's achievements.
